oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 50,000 Acres of Farming Lands
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pamphlets; Land use
Agriculture; Pamphlets; Land settlement
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Eight-page promotional pamphlet advertising ten five-thousand-acre tracts of land for sale in 1881 known as the Manning Lands. The parcels of land were located in Overton, Fentress, and Morgan counties. A fold-out map is included showing the exact location of the tracts.

This pamphlet was intended to attract real estate agencies interested in making large purchases of land in order to later sell either as single tracts or in a body. The company sponsoring the Manning Lands was based in Detroit, Michigan.
